abstract.p: One of Europe's biggest computer service providers, Atos SA of France, will acquire Origin division of Royal Philips Electronics for $2.4 million (S)

block.p: One of Europe's biggest computer service providers, Atos S.A. of France, has agreed to acquire the Origin division of Royal Philips Electronics N.V. of the Netherlands, the leading European electronics group, for $2.4 billion in stock. Philips will acquire 21.5 million shares of Atos Origin, or 48.9 percent of the combined company, with an obligation to reduce the stake below 35 percent within two years. Analysts said the acquisition would give Atos the size it needed to compete with larger rivals like Cap Gemini of France and Getronics of the Netherlands, but at the price of poorer profitability, given recent declines in Origin's revenue and profit.

One of Europe's biggest computer service providers, Atos S.A. of France, has agreed to acquire the Origin division of Royal Philips Electronics N.V. of the Netherlands, the leading European electronics group, for $2.4 billion in stock. Philips will acquire 21.5 million shares of Atos Origin, or 48.9 percent of the combined company, with an obligation to reduce the stake below 35 percent within two years. Analysts said the acquisition would give Atos the size it needed to compete with larger rivals like Cap Gemini of France and Getronics of the Netherlands, but at the price of poorer profitability, given recent declines in Origin's revenue and profit.
